ngiemboon: M bɔ́ɔnte ńgyá tsɔ́ mmó gíŋ ńkẅɛɛ lefaŋ, ńgwɔ́ wó tɛʼ, ńgwɔ́ gie á gÿo mé vege vege, é gwɔ́ Mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé sɔɔnmbʉ́a. Pɔ́ tyéte ńgẅiinte ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ mentí sɔɔnmbʉ́a mie é ge kúu na pʉ̀a mesoŋ, é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ menzsònzèm mengʉ̀ngʉ̀, á nue lóŋ Ssé ge gÿo gwaa pʉ́le, mbà mɛ̌ mengʉ̀ngʉ̀ tɔ̌g.
en: Then I saw another great and awe-inspiring sign   in heaven:  # 15:1 Mt 16:1; 24:30; Lk 21:11; Ac 2:19; Rv 12:1,3; 13:13 seven angels with the seven last plagues; for with them God’s wrath will be completed.  # 15:1 Jn 19:30; Rv 10:7; 16:17; 17:17

ngiemboon: N gíŋ ńgyá tsɔ̌ ntí tetʉ́a, ésaŋte páʼ ntse tépàa, ńne síi pɔ́ páʼ tsɔ̌ ntí tóon gie e gwɔ̌ pɔ́ páʼ gyɛ̀shÿó, mé tóŋ lê Kilisetaa la. Á gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie mmɔ̌g ée tsoló ńne ńkyɛʼɛ jʉʼ la. Epʉ̀a tyéte ndùm wó, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é mǎʼ ncù tà ńcʉa nkʉ̀ʼʉ nɔ̀ɔn, é pʉ̀a pie é kaa tútú we guʼte, ńké te zẅíŋ mé ŋweʼe menómbà mie é laʼte lezíŋ sé na pɔ́b wɔ́. Megàŋ gẅiin tsɔ̌ ntí mekèkÿɛ̀ mbwó pɔ́b, é gwɔ́ mie e Ssé la ná né pɔ́b.
en: I also saw something like a sea of glass   mixed with fire, and those who had won the victory over the beast, its image,  # 15:2 Other mss add his mark and the number of its name, were standing on the sea of glass with harps from God.  # 15:2 Rv 5:8; 14:2

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ńzɔbɔ mezɔ̀bɔ ntse mie, Mǒonsê, ngàŋafàʼ Ssé la zɔb, ńgíŋe ńne ńzɔbɔ mie Múɔ Njʉ̀njÿò la zɔb, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: They sang the song of God’s servant Moses   and the song of the Lamb:

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ngwɔ́ wɔ̌ nyé té pɔ́gɔ gú?
N gyá sɔɔn shúm tà ńtsẅé jʉʼ, e Ssé gíŋ ńnyɛ́ʼ nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn, n gyá jʉʼ yé gie áa tÿǒ lepwó, á nyɛ́ʼɛ ńtyé, ntàb gie e nyɛɛ ngie e Ssé ee nùɔ pʉ̀a pé, é tyé tsoló.
en: After this I looked, and the heavenly temple #— #the tabernacle of testimony    #— #was opened.  # 15:5 Rv 11:19

ngiemboon: Mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé sɔɔnmbʉ́a, pie é la gẅiin ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ mentí sɔɔnmbʉ́a la, fó jʉʼʉ ssé ńkẅɛ, ḿmaʼ metàʼ shʉ̀a meféfɔ́gɔ nzsǒ, é ne ńŋwʉŋe. Mbà pɔ́ lɔgɔ́ tsɔ́ pɔ̌ɔn mmó, ńtʉ́me kʉ́kʉ́b wɔb, á gwɔ́ gie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte.
en: Out of the temple came the seven angels with the seven plagues, dressed in pure, bright linen, with golden sashes wrapped around their chests.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tàʼ na menɔ̀ɔn pa lekùɔ, á ná mentúʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a mbwó mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé pa sɔɔnmbʉ́a. Mentúʼ ŋwɛ́ gwɔ́ mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte, agyáŋalóŋ Ssé gie ee ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó na ngùʼ nkɔ́ɔn né nkɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ mentúʼ ŋwɛ́ tà ńdúe.
en: One of the four living creatures gave the seven angels seven golden bowls filled with the wrath of God who lives forever and ever.

ngiemboon: Metʉ̀ Ssé pɔ́ legúʼ we, pú ńgÿo endyé kúu tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼ yé tà ńdúe, tà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ te kuʼu lékúu tsoló wɔ́, tà ńdáʼ ńkú fʉ̀ʼ gie mentí mengʉ̀ngʉ̀ ma sɔɔnmbʉ́a mie ée mbwó mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé sɔɔnmbʉ́a la, é tɔ̌g tà ḿmag.
en: Then the temple was filled with smoke from the glory of God and from his power,   and no one could enter the temple until the seven plagues of the seven angels were completed.
